issues.description: The problem statement says “The birthday should be stored as an ISO-8601 formatted String” (implying the birthday field is a String), but both the template and the solution define Person.birthday as java.time.LocalDate and all code/tests operate on LocalDate (e.g., PersonService.save uses person.getBirthday().isAfter(LocalDate.now()), tests set birthday with LocalDate). This type mismatch between the specification and the provided code will confuse students about which type to use and will block correct implementation if they follow the problem text literally.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the problem statement with the code: replace the sentence saying the birthday is stored as an ISO-8601 String with a statement that the birthday is stored as a java.time.LocalDate (or otherwise update all template/solution code and tests to use String). Given the template and tests already use LocalDate, the preferred fix is to update the problem statement to specify LocalDate for the birthday field.
